title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Juvenile Delinquency Forms (Family Court Act Article 3), form 3-17 - Examination report (to determine capacity)
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Juvenile Delinquency Forms (Family Court Act Article 3), form 3-17 - Examination report (to determine capacity)

State Regulations

Secs. 301.2, 322.1 F.C.A. Form 3-17
(Juvenile Delinquency)
7/83
TO THE FAMILY COURT OF THE STATE OF NEW
YORK
COUNTY OF ________
________
In the Matter of Docket No. ________
________ EXAMINATION REPORT
(To Determine Capacity)
A Person Alleged to be a

Juvenile Delinquent, ________ Respondent. ________
________ a duly (qualified psychiatrist)
(certified psychologist) hereby reports as follows: 1. I examined ________, the Respondent
herein, pursuant to an order of the Court dated ________, 19 ________, to
determine whether Respondent is (mentally ill) (mentally retarded or
developmentally disabled)
on (date) ________ at (location)
________
on (date) ________ at (location)
________
2. Based upon the above examination(s), in
my professional judgment, ________
(is) (is not) an incapacitated persons as
defined in subdivision (13) of section
301.2
of the

Family Court Act. [FN1]3. I base this opinion upon the
following
a. Diagnosis
b. Prognosis
[FN2]4. The following is a detailed
statement of the reasons for my opinion: [Make particular reference to those
aspects of the proceedings wherein Respondent lacks capacity to understand or
to assist in defense.]
____________
____________
____________
Dated: ________, 19________. ________
[FN3](Qualified Psychiatrist)

Signature
[FN4](Certified Psychologist)
[FN1] (Note to examiner) If a finding of
incapacity is made, you must complete items 3 and 4 of this form. [FN2] Applicable if report finds

Respondent to be an incapacitated person. [FN3] Strike out one. [FN4] Strike out one. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 22, subtit. D, ch. IV, subch. A, Juvenile Delinquency

Forms (Family Court Act Article 3), form
3-17

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
